Class Storage

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Tiles.Component
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Model.Tiles.Storage
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SpecialStorageCompartment, StorageCompartment
public abstract class Storage extends Component
Represents an abstract storage component that can hold goods in a structured game model. This class is intended to be extended by specialized storage components and provides basic functionality such as managing goods, interacting with the player board, and implementing visitor-based actions.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • rotate

      public void rotate(Boolean direction)
      Rotates the component of the storage in the specified direction. The rotation behavior is determined by the implementation of the component.
      Specified by:
      rotate in class Component
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction to rotate; true for clockwise and false for counterclockwise

    • accept

      public void accept(ComponentAction visitor, PlayerState State)
      Accepts a visitor that performs an action based on the current state of the player and the specific type of this component. This method allows the visitor to execute the appropriate logic for this component type using the visitor pattern.
      Overrides:
      accept in class Component
      Parameters:
      visitor - the ComponentAction visitor implementing the logic to be executed
      State - the current state of the player, used to validate the action or determine its effects

    • controlValidity

      public boolean controlValidity(PlayerBoard pb, int x, int y)
      Determines if the specified coordinates (x, y) on the given PlayerBoard pass the validity check for a specific operation or condition.
      Specified by:
      controlValidity in class Component
      Parameters:
      pb - the PlayerBoard on which the validity check is performed
      x - the x-coordinate on the PlayerBoard to be checked
      y - the y-coordinate on the PlayerBoard to be checked
      Returns:
      true if the specified coordinates are valid according to the check; otherwise, false

    • insert

      public void insert(PlayerBoard playerBoard, int x, int y)
      Inserts an element into the storage at the specified coordinates on the player's board.
      Specified by:
      insert in class Component
      Parameters:
      playerBoard - the player's board where the element will be inserted
      x - the x-coordinate where the element will be inserted
      y - the y-coordinate where the element will be inserted

    • remove

      public void remove(PlayerBoard playerBoard)
      Removes a specific interaction or data associated with the given player board from this storage component.
      Specified by:
      remove in class Component
      Parameters:
      playerBoard - the player's board from which the removal operation is performed

    • getValue

      public int getValue(int i)
      Retrieves the value of the goods at the specified index in the storage.
      Parameters:
      i - the index of the goods item in the storage list
      Returns:
      the integer value associated with the goods at the specified index

    • removeGood

      public Goods removeGood(int i)
      Removes a good from the list of goods stored in the storage and returns it.
      Parameters:
      i - the index of the good to be removed
      Returns:
      the good that was removed, or null if no good exists at the specified index

    • addGood

      public void addGood(Goods good)
      Adds a good to the storage component.
      Parameters:
      good - the good to be added. Must be a valid instance of a class implementing the Goods interface.

    • getGoods

      public ArrayList<Goods> getGoods()
      Retrieves the list of goods stored in the storage.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing Goods objects currently held in the storage

    • sendState

      public void sendState()
      Handles the communication of the current state of the storage component. This method is a placeholder intended to be implemented by subclasses or used for operations involving the state of the storage or its associated goods. Intended for scenarios where the state of the `Storage` needs to be transmitted, logged, or otherwise used in interactions with other components, such as a player board or external systems.
